Merge pull request #357 from Futurelearn/clean-up-test-output

Clean up test output

Standardise mocha version and avoid deprecation message

Mocha versions differ in the different appraisal files; in later
versions, it wants us to require 'mocha/minitest' instead of
'mocha/mini_test', so some of the appraisal groups cause warnings.

This updates them all to the latest mocha, and uses the new load file.

Implement missing setup_locales test

This test didn't have a definition body, so caused a "skipped test"
warning in the test output.

To get rid of the warning, this adds a basic test body.

Update redises for Fixnum deprecation

When running the tests in ruby 2.5, a lot of warnings are generated
about ::Fixnum being deprecated, caused by the redis gem.

This updates the redis gems in our various gemfiles to avoid the
deprecation message.

Because redis-rb has gained a major version, I've split the changes:

* Main and rails51 gemfiles: latest redis-rb
* rails41 gemfiles: minimum supported version containing the deprecation
  fix (3.3.3)

To achieve this I've locked the rails41 gemfiles at redis-rb 3.3.3
(instead of using >=), so it's clear we want them to stay at the minimum
supported version possible.

I've allowed the redis-namespace versions to jump to the latest version
in all gemfiles since all gemfiles were already on a version well past
the specified minimum.

Explicitly enumerate routes in dummy test app

In the Rails 5.1 appraisal group, the following warning is generated:

    DEPRECATION WARNING: Using a dynamic :controller segment in a route
    is deprecated and will be removed in Rails 5.2. (called from block
    in <top (required)> at
    /Users/simon/dev/clones/vanity/test/dummy/config/route
    s.rb:57)

This is because of the wildcard route in the dummy test app:

    match ':controller(/:action(/:id(.:format)))', :via => [:get, :post]

To avoid this message, this change explicitly enumerates the routes used
by the dummy app. This is a mild hassle, but could be reduced in future
if vanity were turned into a rails engine, meaning most of the routes
would be provided directly by the gem.

Prevent Commands.report test from writing to stdout

This command writes a report to a file, and prints a message to stdout
with the report location.

This change suppresses the message during the test, as it otherwise
breaks up the build output and makes it less easy to find errors.

Merge pull request #356 from Futurelearn/full-redis-destroy

Fully destroy experiments using the Redis adapter

Bump yard version to avoid errors

With rubygems 2.7+, the installed version of yard raises the following
error:

    Error loading RubyGems plugin ->
    yard-0.8.7.6/lib/rubygems_plugin.rb": can't modify frozen Hash
    (RuntimeError)

This is fixed in more recent versions, so this bumps yard to address the
issue.

Fully destroy experiments using the Redis adapter

Currently the redis adapter's #destroy_experiment method only removes
experiment metadata; all participant data is retained even if the
experiment is reset. This can lead to large numbers of old keys hanging
around in redis instances, requiring manual cleanup.

This change uses redis's SCAN command[1] to delete all keys matching the
experiment prefix, which should completely reset the experiment.

The SCAN command inherently works in batches, each time returning a
cursor value that can be used in subsequent calls; when the cursor "0"
is returned, the scan is complete.

[1] https://redis.io/commands/scan

Fix support for redis client v4.

Closes https://github.com/assaf/vanity/issues/350.
Update migrations for rails 5.1+ versioned migrations.
Update travis for rails 51.

Merge pull request #330 from Futurelearn/rails-5-1-view-load-fix

Fix `add_participant` on Rails 5.1

Fix `add_participant` on Rails 5.1

In Rails 5 the `render` method deprecated a number of options including
the `nothing` option [1] (this option was removed entirely in Rails
5.1).

Previously vanity relied on this method for implementing its
`add_participant` controller endpoint.

Rather than using `render nothing: true`, we can use the `head` method
if we do not require a body in the response.

**Notes**

It looks like the `head` method is available in all versions of Rails
supported by Vanity (including Rails 3.2).

[1] https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/20336

Merge pull request #317 from Futurelearn/deprecate-ab-seen-with-alternative-instance

Deprecate calling #ab_seen with alternative instance

Use alternative id in ab_seen calls, not Alternative instance

In the previous commit, calling `#ab_seen` with an alternative instance was
deprecated in favour of calling with an alternative id, to bring the method
signature into line with the rest of the abstract adapter API.

This updates the only internal caller to the new style.

Deprecate #ab_seen with Alternative instance

Currently all methods in the storage adapter interface that accept an
`alternative` argument accept it in the form of an alternative ID. The
exception to this is `#ab_seen`, which accepts an Alternative instance.

Since third-party code might depend on this, this change at first deprecates
the old usage while allowing both calling styles. The old usage can then be
removed in a future version.

Silence deprecation warnings from legacy connecting test

This test involves resetting Vanity, which sets a new logger at the default
level. This means that the legacy configuration method it supports prints a
deprecation to the test output.

We can capture the IO and assert the presence of a deprecation message
instead using minitest's #capture_io, setting a new logger within the captured
block.

Merge pull request #316 from Futurelearn/use-shared-adapter-tests

Use shared tests for all adapters

Run ActiveRecord and Mongodb adapter tests only when told

The new adapter tests are effectively new levels of integration test against
the different adapters. Because some test setup is only performed when the
relevant `DB` value is present in the environment, these tests will fail the
travis build unless restricted like this.

Ignore multi-valued metrics in shared adapter tests

Multi-valued metrics were introduced some time ago[1], but the public API
supporting them (Metric#values, which returns values binned by date) has only
ever returned a single value per day.[2]

Currently the different adapters' implementations of #metric_values behave
differently for multi-valued metrics.

* The mock and mongodb adapters return an array per day, with the totals for
  each metric value seen per day
* The redis adapter returns an array summing only the first metric value seen
  per day, as a string
* The ActiveRecord adapter returns an array containing the sum of *all* values
  seen per day

While I think this may be completely unused behaviour, I can't rule out
third-party code that uses multi-valued metrics, so for the time being I'm
loosening the test to ignore multi-valued metrics, and ensuring that the Redis
adapter returns integers instead of strings.

[1] 10b1523d
[2] https://github.com/assaf/vanity/blob/0c241e3e78d5593824125031f897a6ca4bfe7170/lib/vanity/metric/base.rb#L211

Merge pull request #311 from sdhull/docs-update

Docs source: Add note about rebalance_frequency for bayes_bandit_score

Loosen specification on ab_seen

Some adapters return nil, others false, so the tests need loosening to capture
this discrepancy.

Use exposed specification to set up adapters

While most of the adapters work with an empty options hash, the mongo adapter
requires more configuration to instantiate successfully.

I've split out the test config in test_helper.rb to allow direct access to the
different configurations, and used the previously-introduced
Connection::Specification class to parse these strings into options that can
be passed to the adapters.

Refactor connection to allow specs to be built elsewhere

Now that more adapter tests are being added, it's useful to be able to
instantiate an adapter without going via the Connection class.

However, most of the test setup provides connection specs as strings,
requiring an extra parsing step that's currently baked into Connection, making
it hard for others to use.

This extracts the spec parsing into a Specification class for external use,
without altering the behaviour of Connection.

Fix `ActiveRecordAdapter#ab_add_conversion` with implicit=true

Previously this added a participant for the alternative and recorded a
conversion for them, but did not record the alternative they had seen, meaning
the ab_counts were wrong.

This updates the implicit creation to record the alternative seen.
Apply shared adapter tests to MongodbAdapter
Apply shared adapter tests to ActiveRecordAdapter

Set up 'real' experiment for shared adapter tests

Previously the shared adapter tests simply passed experiment and metric labels
to the various methods, since the MockAdapter (where these tests were
introduced) didn't care too much about whether an experiment was properly set
up before storing data.

Other adapters are more picky, however, so it's useful to have a
properly-initiated experiment, using the new_ab_test helper. Tests
specifically requiring a non-existent experiment now use a different
experiment label.

Adapter test for `#is_persisted?` should use created_at

While MockAdapter tests for the presence of any experiment data at all to
check persistence, other adapters check specifically for the created_at date,
so the test needs to match this behaviour.

Relax resolution on adapter timestamp tests

While the mock adapter stores Time instances, other adapters are limited by
their storage layer, usually to 1s accuracy, so we can only assert that
timestamps are accurate to the second.

Apply shared adapter tests to RedisAdapter

At present these don't all pass for the RedisAdapter for a variety of reasons
- fixes will follow in individual commits.

Move DummyAlternative definition out of dynamic context

In its original location, this constant assignment caused a ruby warning, so
hoist it to a static location.

Extract mock adapter tests to shareable module

Previously a set of behavioural tests for MockAdapter were introduced.
However, these tests cover behaviour that should be shared by all adapters,
and provides coverage that the other adapters don't yet have.

This change extracts the tests to a module that can be included in the
existing and any new adapter tests, as well as used by anyone developing their
own adapter.

Clients only need to define an `#adapter` method in their test class;
including the module then imports all the tests.

Merge pull request #309 from Futurelearn/fix-mock-adapter

Implement #ab_seen and #ab_assigned in MockAdapter

De-duplicate alternative fetching in MockAdapter

Previously there was some boilerplate initialization of the alternatives
storage; I've extracted this to a couple of private helper methods and updated

Implement missing methods on mock adapter

Previously the ab_seen and ab_assigned methods on the mock adapter were
missing; as they were defined in the abstract adapter, they raised "not
implemented" errors if called.

This adds implementations for the extra methods.

Merge pull request #308 from bazzargh/patch-1

Fix 'base 17' typo, correct id bucketing

Fix 'base 17' typo, correct id bucketing

MD5.hexdigest provides a flat (but noisy) distribution of hex digits, but the typo converting them back to integers with base 17 adds a very slight bias to the results, increasing the size of some low-order buckets. eg this calculation using a range instead of MD5 to provide the evenly distributed input: (0..9999999).each_with_object(Hash.new(0)) {|d, h| h[d.to_s(16).to_i(17) % 100 < 5] += 1 } => {true=>500025, false=>9499975} . It's only a slight loading of the dice, and would be very hard to spot in real experiments because it's lost in the noise of the MD5 distribution. Spotted via code review not tests.

Merge some ApartmentList changes into Vanity 2.0.0

Merged the [changes developed by ApartmentList](http://blog.apartmentlist.com/vanity-ab-testing/). ([github](https://github.com/apartmentlist/vanity)).

* Experiments start off in the disabled state, and only become enabled after a dashboard interaction.
* Enable & disable experiments with the push of a button.  When disabled, the `default` choice is used.
* Control when and how experiments should complete by clicking a 'complete' button on the dashboard.
* Changed active record `increment!` to `update_counters` which performs an atomic SQL update.

Merge pull request #239 from sebjacobs/seb-ruby-2-2-support

Introduce Ruby 2.2 support.

Introduce Ruby 2.2 support.

Ruby 2.2 introduced a change into how default arguments are parsed[1].

Now when you wish to use a method as a default argument you need to be
explicit by using parenthasis.

For example

`def bar(foo=foo)`

will need to be re-written

`def bar(foo=foo())`

This commit introduces a fix for this issue.

*Note* I initially looked into updating the specs (to use ruby 2.2.0),
however I ran into a number of issues with the appraisal test suite and
older versions of rails.

[1]https://bugs.ruby-lang.org/issues/10314

Merge pull request #229 from rsslldnphy/override-templates

Allow Rails applications to override default views

Add `custom_templates_path` configuration option.

Vanity.playground now has a configuration option,
`custom_templates_path`, which is used as a search location for custom
templates (to override the default ones in the gem).

By default this option is set to `app/views/vanity` in order to work
with Rails.

Allow Rails applications to override default views

The first time a template is rendered, Vanity checks to see if the path
'app/views/vanity' exists, and if so will load templates from that
location. Otherwise templates are loaded from the gem as normal.

This commit also adds a Rails generator to put copies of the original
templates into 'app/views/vanity'.

Merge pull request #214 from assaf/feature/lazy-load

Lazy-load Rails frameworks

Lazy-load Rails frameworks

* Avoid loading ActionController/ActionMailer::Base until they're needed
* Avoid loading ActiveRecord::Base until it's needed

A big part of the reason for the slowness is due to plugins referencing parts of Rails that don't necessarily need to be loaded, so, eg, ActiveRecord::Base gets pulled in even when just trying to run 'rake routes'. As of Rails 3.0, this can be avoided using on_load hooks.

Lo and behold, MongoDB adapter just showed up!
Fixed a few places that had redis:/ instead of redis://.

Added upgrade command. When upgrading to 1.4 (or even head, from now on), please run:
  vanity upgrade

Using Redis namespace and all Vanity objects are now in the vanity: namespace.

Updated documentation to cover how to run against all or particular
Ruby implementation, all or particular adapter.

New adapter API. Metrics and experiments now use this API instead of
accessing Redis directly, so it won't be too hard to add a MongoDB
or MySQL adapter.

Clarify that default connection configuration uses Vanity.
Only load Redis gem if using Redis adapter.

Connection adapters! We have a new way for managing connections which extends
to multiple adapters (not just Redis). The easiest is to use the configuration
file config/vanity.yml. For example:

  development:
    adapter: redis
  test:
    adapter: mock
  heroku:
    adapter: activerecord

Now using RVM, gemsets and Bundler to test Vanity in different configurations.
To run the full set of tests in all the supported versions of Ruby:
  rake test:rubies
To test specific version of Ruby:
  rake test:rubies[1.8.7]
To switch around:
  rvm 1.9.2@vanity

This release switches from a pre-2.0 version of the Redis gem that was bundled
with Vanity, to a 2.0.x version of the Redis gem used as a dependency. If your
code uses the Redis gem directly, watch out for subtle incompatibility bugs.
Added rake test:rubies for testing with multiple versions of Ruby (requires RVM).
Issue 14: if you've got a File, just call unlink on it.

Another typo fix, btw check out emend, cool way to make corrections on other people's sites:
http://www.emendapp.com/sites/vanity.labnotes.org/edits/0

Added test cases for Google Analytics methods (and in the process found and fixed a bug).

Added documentation for using Google Analytics metrics.
Added report method to GA metric, for accessing Garb report object.

Changed: streamlined options for vanity command.
Fixed: couple of bugs when generating reports offline (using vanity report command).
Fixed documentation/README for initializing and using the vanity report command.
Fixed documentation/README for using Bundler to handle development dependencies.
Another fix, and revised documentation to (more likely to work) configuration.
Fix to lazy loading Garb.

Added: Vanity loads Redis configuration from config/redis.yml (if you have such a file).
Added Playground.connected? method, renamed Playground.mock! to Playground.test!.

Documentation updates:

    Moved dashboard documentation there.
      Revised configuration section, up to date for Vanity 1.3.0.

Fixed: Running vanity command, automatically detects and loads Rails.
Fixed: Vanity now picks up on load_path set from within config/environment.rb.

Rails integration code moved to lib/vanity/frameworks/rails.
Yes, more frameworks should and will be supported.
Also, fixed bug that did not allow changing load_path under Rails (see Github issue #4)
To specify connection, use Vanity.playground.redis = "localhost:6379". The host/port/db attributes are deprecated.
Fixed: AbTest incorrectly calls identify method instead of identity (issue #2)
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:assaf/vanity

Added disconnect! and reconnect! methods to Playground that can be used to establish a new Redis connection.
When running inside Passenger, forking the process will immediately reconnect the Playground in the forked process.

Started using Gemfile to setup development environment (requires Bundler 0.9.4 or later)

$ git clone git://github.com/assaf/vanity.git
$ cd vanity
$ bundle install
$ bundle exec autotest -f

Updated copyright to 2010.
fix typo in docs
Bumped version number, added short blurb in CHANGELOG, more documentation to follow.
Merge branch 'garb'
Fix: experiment not saved.

Split vanity/metric.rb into three files: base, active_record and google_analytics.
When using AR and GA metrics, methods are redefined by extending the metric object. This has less magic and better documentation.
hook method not available on Google Analytics metric.
Metric with google_analytics no longer failed to load when offline.
Google Analytics metrics using Garb.
Removed: Vanity.playground.define is deprecated. Bad choice for a method name. If you need this feature, make a suggestion and let's create a better API.
Consolidates loading of metrics and experiments.
Added: Command line "vanity list" catalogs all ongoing experiments, their alternatives (and fingerprints) and all metrics.
Added: Vanity query parameter that you can use to choose a particular alternative, e.g. to tie an advertisement banner with content of the site.

* Changed: Rails integration now separates use_vanity method, filters and helpers.
* Changed: Explicit vanity_context_filter and vanity_reload_filter so you can skip them, or order filters relative to them.
Added default_identify to experiment replacing block with slightly smarter (and easier to override) logic.
Fixed: if metric cannot be loaded (e.g. offline, no db access) show error message for that metric but don't break dashboard.

Autoload Redis, give installed version precedence.
Add "who's using?" link on site sidebar.
More dynamic in the layout.
Contributing page links to open issues page.
Added number of downloads in sidebar (using Gemcutter API).
Show watchers, forks and link to github traffic report in sidebar.
Added Tony Pitale's tip on removing application layout.
Open issues listed on contributing page.
Tag releases with vX.Y.Z (see http://semver.org/)
Refined metrics documentation.
Styling.

Better error handling when calling Vanity.model with unsupported options.
Fixed: Playground no longer changes logging level on supplied logger.
Change timescale and tooltips in report to use UTC.
Using contexts, based on code from http://gist.github.com/25455

Vanity.playground.metrics craps if it fails to load metrics instead of just silently being wrong.
Updated documentation.
Fixed nasty "can't count from 0" bug.

Correction to get scopes really working (and fully tested).
Updated documentation for metrics.
ActiveRecord metrics with scope work.

ActiveRecord metrics now support different aggregate functions: average, sum, minimum, maximum. For example:

metric "Satisfaction" do
  model Survey, :average=>:rating
end

Fixed 1.8.6 compatibility issue.
Improved Rails configuration use.
A/B test tracking no longer fails if identity missing.
Added: Playground.load!. Now loading all metrics and experiments from Rails initializer.
Note: Playground.experiments returns hash instead of array. (you probably don't use this method, but if you do, note the change)

ActiveRecord metric can use conditions, for example:
  metric "High ratings" do
    model Rating, :conditions=>["stars >= 4"]
  end

Added: track! and ab_test methods now available from Object (i.e. everywhere).
Removed: Object.experiment is deprecated, please call Vanity.playground.experiment directly.
Create random identifier using ActiveSupport::SecureRandom instead of OpenSSL.
Tests more likely to pass if we don't try to drop non-existent table.

Fixed 1.8.6 compatibility issue.
Bumped version to 1.2.0.

This release introduces metrics backed by ActiveRecord.  Use them when your model is already tracking a metric, and you get instant historical data.

Example, track sign ups using User model:

  metric "Signups" do
    model User
  end

Example, track satisfaction using Survey model:
  metric "Satisfaction" do
    model Survey, :rating
  end

There's no need to call track! on these metrics.

Changed: Decoupled metric name from identifier.  You can now define a metric with more descriptive name, e.g. "Cheers per second (user satisfaction)" and keep their ID simple.  Identifier is matched against the file name (for metrics loaded from experiments/metrics).

Changed: Metrics no longer defined on-demand, i.e. calling playground.metric either returns existing metric or raises exception.
1.1.1 release brings True 1.8 Compatibility(tm)
Fix binding issue under 1.8.6.
Fixed print styling.
Added image on metrics page.
Prep for 1.1.0 release.

track! gets count.
metric loading gets fancy scope.
Added documentation for metrics.
Clear @completed_at when destroying experiment.
Fixed A/B alternative choosing to work with jQuery (previously required Prototype.js or jRails).
Cool new: you can now see experiement timelines against each metric, check radio buttons at buttom of page.
Fix: Rails routing missing :action/:id (thanks Ian Sefferman)
Fix: strftime using an option that's only available in Ruby 1.9 (Ian Sefferman)

Use Vanity.playground.mock! when running tests and you'd rather not access a live Redis server.
For development: rake test runs with mock redis, rake test:redis uses live server (db 15).
Switched to redis-rb from http://github.com/ezmobius/redis-rb.

Metric plotting code moved to a separate JS file.
Metric graphs now higher, have 3 ticks on Y-axis, easier to see hover point.
New, easier URL mapping for Dashboard: map.vanity "/vanity", :controller=>:vanity.

Changed: Now throwing NameError instead of LoadError when failing to load experiment/metric.  NameError can be rescued on same line.
Added: Tagline in Vanity report and generated by Vanity footer.
Fixed: Playground loads metrics based on database entries instead of file names.
Added: Link to Textile and RDoc references.
Fixed tests to run without Redis instance, hence restoring peace to the build system.

Documentation updated to show how to use ab_test in combination with metrics.
Issue warning if A/B test does not specify which metric it uses.
AbTest.measures => metrics.

A/B test tracking how happens through metric.
Added measures method for A/B tests.
Changed: playground.metric only returns metrics loaded from experiments/metrics.
Playground.track! no longer passes vanity identity to metric.track! (or hook).

Metric.description is now an attribute (and method, yuck)
Example metrics now defined in their own directory.

Changed: Console becomes Dashboard, which is less confusing with rails console (script/console).

mkdir fix to help CI scripts not fall over for lack of permissions.

Revised documentation index.
README has same five steps (to A/B test).

Using new kid on the block YARD to produce API documentation.
Added: A/B test report now showing number of participants.
Changed: AbTest score method accepts minimum probability (default 90), and only returns choice alternative with probability equal or higher than that.
Changed: Experiment confidence becomes probability.

Changed: You can break long experiment descriptions into multiple paragraphs
using two consecutive newlines.
Commit for checking out Git hook
Rails console uses AJAX requests to update A/B experiment.

Added: h method available to templates (shortcut to escape_html)
Changed: A/B experiment chosen? => showing?
Supporting files (CSS for now) included directly in termplate (was: by calling render).

This release changes the way you define a new experiment.  You can use a
method suitable for the type of experiment you want to define, or call the
generic define method (previously: experiment method).  For example:

  ab_test "My A/B test" do
	  alternatives :a, :b
	end

The experiment method is no longer overloaded: it looks up an experiment
(loading its definition if necessary), but does not define an experiment.
The ab_test method is overloaded, though this may change in the future.

* Changed: playground.define now requires an experiment type, ab_test is not
the default any more.
Changed: When you run Vanity in development mode (configuration.cache_classes = false), it will reload experiments on each request. You can also Vanity.playground.reload!.

Changed: Redis 1.0 is now vendored into Vanity. This means one less
dependecy ... actually two, since Redis brings with it RSpec.
Save the credits for later.
Shorter RDoc with link to online docs.
Changed to MIT license.

Version bump.
More formal command names.
Switch README image to show Rails console.

Rails console shows current experiments status and also allows you to
choose which alternative you want to see.

Changed: experiment.chooses uses Redis to store state, better for (when we get to) browser integration

Changed: experiment.chooses skips recording participant or conversion.
Changed: experiment.score returns populated alternative objects instead of structs.
Changed: experiment.alternatives is now an immutable snapshot.
Link to RubyConf presentation schedule.
Template fixes and added image top README.
Sexed up the forms.
Added: shiny reports.
* Changed: letters instead of numbers for options (option 1 => option A).
* Added: score now includes least performing alternatives, names and values.
And ... it's a wrap.
Round conversion to 3 places, don't show conversion difference if under 1%.

score now returns difference from least performing alternative.
score now returns best (overall) and choice (with confidence) alternatives.
confidence calculated on absolute z-score (so 90% can go both ways).
fixed: outcome will now be highest converting alternative, even if we can't say so with confidence.
Claims.

Added: experiment alternative name (option 1, option 2, etc).

Added: new scoring algorithm: use experiment.score instead of
alternative.z_score/confidence.
rake report is useful for testing out the report feature.
* Added: reset an experiment by calling reset!.
Added: return alternative by value from experiment.alternative(val) method.
Added: vanity binary, with single command for generating a report.

Changed: default alternatives are now false/true, so if can't decide
outcome, fall back on false.
Added: test auto-completion and auto-outcome (complete_it, outcome_is).
Version bump.
* Added: z-score and confidence level for A/B test alternatives.
Added: use_vanity now accepts block instead of symbol.
Load all experiments when calling Playground.experiments.

Changed: A/B test experiments alternatives now handled using Alternatives
object.

Removed: A/B test measure method no longer in use.
Shorter namespaces.
Rolled configuration into playground.
* Added: experiment method on object, used to define and access experiments.
Changed: Vanity::Helpers becomes Vanity::Rails.
Rails testing can force particular choice on A/B test with experiment(id).chooses(value).

A/B experiments now record both converted participant (once each) and number of conversions (multiples allowed).

Bug fixes.

To use Vanity with Rails:
  require "vanity/rails"

To configure Vanity:
  Vanity.playground.config = { ... }
  Vanity.playground.config[name] = value

Experiment now links back to playground.

Changed the way we obtain Vanity identity.  Instead of global set by the filter we use a block to calculate the identity from within the experiment, allowing experiments to work differently (e.g. one experiment will use user's id, another may use project id).

No more Vanity.identity.
Also A/B test experiment methods are now choose and conversion! (was choise and converted).
Tinkering with experiment reports.
Separating experiment name & experiment ID.

A/B tests: alternatives no longer stored in Redis.
A/B tests: default test is true/false.
Experiment only stores created_at timestamps.

Documentation on how to use Rails helpers for A/B testing.
Rails helpers for A/B testing: use_vanity, ab_test and ab_goal!
